alert.note: Alert for Menifee; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:35PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Powell, Montgomery and west central Menifee Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 634 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westbend, or 7 miles northwest of Stanton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Levee and Klondike around 645 PM EDT. Prewitt around 650 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Camargo, Mount Sterling, Bean, Gatewoods Station, Jeffersonville, Upper Spencer, Lucky Stop, Coons Station, Ewington, Oggs Station, Lower Spencer, Clay Lick, Howards Mill, Cedar Groves, Means and Walkers Crossing. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 12 and 16. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 112 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
